verses.verse: Your (Jer. 2:8; 23:25-29; 29:8, 9; 37:19; Ezek. 13:2) prophets have seen for you False and deceptive visions; They have not (Is. 58:1; Ezek. 23:36; Mic. 3:8) uncovered your iniquity, To bring back your captives, But have envisioned for you false (Jer. 23:33-36; Ezek. 22:25, 28) prophecies and delusions.

All who pass by (1 Kin. 9:8; Job 27:23; Jer. 18:16; Ezek. 25:6; Nah. 3:19) clap their hands at you; They hiss (2 Kin. 19:21; Ps. 44:14) and shake their heads At the daughter of Jerusalem: “Is this the city that is called ((Ps. 48:2; 50:2); Ezek. 16:14) ‘The perfection of beauty, The joy of the whole earth’?”

(Job 16:9, 10; Ps. 22:13; Lam. 3:46) All your enemies have opened their mouth against you; They hiss and gnash their teeth. They say, (Ps. 56:2; 124:3; Jer. 51:34) “We have swallowed her up! Surely this is the (Lam. 1:21; (Obad. 12-15)) day we have waited for; We have found it, (Ps. 35:21) we have seen it!”

The LORD has done what He (Lev. 26:16) purposed; He has fulfilled His word Which He commanded in days of old. He has thrown down and has not pitied, And He has caused an enemy to (Ps. 38:16) rejoice over you; He has exalted the horn of your adversaries.
Their heart cried out to the Lord, “O wall of the daughter of Zion, (Jer. 14:17; Lam. 1:16) Let tears run down like a river day and night; Give yourself no relief; Give your eyes no rest.

“Arise, (Ps. 119:147) cry out in the night, At the beginning of the watches; (1 Sam. 1:15; Ps. 42:4; 62:8) Pour out your heart like water before the face of the Lord. Lift your hands toward Him For the life of your young children, Who faint from hunger (Is. 51:20) at the head of every street.”

“See, O LORD, and consider! To whom have You done this? (Lev. 26:29; Deut. 28:53; Jer. 19:9; Lam. 4:10; Ezek. 5:10) Should the women eat their offspring, The children they have cuddled? Should the priest and prophet be slain In the sanctuary of the Lord?

“Young (2 Chr. 36:17; Jer. 6:11) and old lie On the ground in the streets; My virgins and my young men Have fallen by the (Jer. 18:21) sword; You have slain them in the day of Your anger, You have slaughtered and not pitied.

“You have invited as to a feast day (Ps. 31:13; Is. 24:17; Jer. 6:25) The terrors that surround me. In the day of the LORD’s anger There was no refugee or survivor. (Hos. 9:12) Those whom I have borne and brought up My enemies have (Jer. 16:2-4; 44:7) destroyed.”
The Prophet’s Anguish and Hope I am the man who has seen affliction by the rod of His wrath.
He has led me and made me walk In darkness and not in light.
Surely He has turned His hand against me Time and time again throughout the day.
He has aged (Job 16:8) my flesh and my skin, And (Ps. 51:8; Is. 38:13) broken my bones.
He has besieged me And surrounded me with bitterness and woe.
((Ps. 88:5, 6; 143:3)) He has set me in dark places Like the dead of long ago.
(Job 3:23; 19:8; Hos. 2:6) He has hedged me in so that I cannot get out; He has made my chain heavy.
Even (Job 30:20; Ps. 22:2) when I cry and shout, He shuts out my prayer.
He has blocked my ways with hewn stone; He has made my paths crooked.
(Is. 38:13) He has been to me a bear lying in wait, Like a lion in ambush.
He has turned aside my ways and (Job 16:12, 13; Jer. 15:3; Hos. 6:1) torn me in pieces; He has made me desolate.
He has bent His bow And (Job 7:20; 16:12; Ps. 38:2) set me up as a target for the arrow.
He has caused (Job 6:4) the arrows of His quiver To pierce my loins.
I have become the (Ps. 22:6, 7; 123:4; Jer. 20:7) ridicule of all my people— (Job 30:9; Ps. 69:12; Lam. 3:63) Their taunting song all the day.
(Jer. 9:15) He has filled me with bitterness, He has made me drink wormwood.
He has also broken my teeth ((Prov. 20:17)) with gravel, And covered me with ashes.
You have moved my soul far from peace; I have forgotten prosperity.
(Ps. 31:22) And I said, “My strength and my hope Have perished from the LORD.”
Remember my affliction and roaming, (Jer. 9:15; Lam. 3:5, 15) The wormwood and the gall.
My soul still remembers And sinks within me.
This I recall to my mind, Therefore I have (Ps. 130:7) hope.
((Mal. 3:6)) Through the LORD’s mercies we are not consumed, Because His compassions (Ps. 78:38; (Jer. 3:12; 30:11)) fail not.
They are new (Is. 33:2; Zeph. 3:5) every morning; Great is Your faithfulness.
“The LORD is my (Ps. 16:5; 73:26; 119:57; Jer. 10:16) portion,” says my soul, “Therefore I (Jer. 17:17; Mic. 7:7) hope in Him!”
The LORD is good to those who (Ps. 130:6; Is. 30:18) wait for Him, To the soul who seeks Him.
It is good that one should ((Rom. 4:16-18)) hope (Ex. 14:13; Ps. 37:7; Is. 7:4) and wait quietly For the salvation of the LORD.
(Ps. 94:12) It is good for a man to bear The yoke in his youth.
(Jer. 15:17) Let him sit alone and keep silent, Because God has laid it on him;
(Job 42:6) Let him put his mouth in the dust— There may yet be hope.
(Job 16:10; Is. 50:6; (Matt. 5:39; 26:67); Mark 14:65; Luke 22:63) Let him give his cheek to the one who strikes him, And be full of reproach.
(Ps. 77:7; 94:14; (Is. 54:7-10)) For the Lord will not cast off forever.
Though He causes grief, Yet He will show compassion According to the multitude of His mercies.
For ((Ps. 119:67, 71, 75; Is. 28:21; Ezek. 33:11; Heb. 12:10)) He does not afflict willingly, Nor grieve the children of men.
To crush under one’s feet All the prisoners of the earth,
To turn aside the justice due a man Before the face of the Most High,
Or subvert a man in his cause— ((Jer. 22:3; Hab. 1:13)) The Lord does not approve.
Who is he ((Ps. 33:9-11)) who speaks and it comes to pass, When the Lord has not commanded it?
Is it not from the mouth of the Most High That (Job 2:10; (Is. 45:7); Jer. 32:42; Amos 3:6; (James 3:10, 11)) woe and well-being proceed?
(Prov. 19:3) Why should a living man complain, (Jer. 30:15; Mic. 7:9; (Heb. 12:5, 6)) A man for the punishment of his sins?
Let us search out and examine our ways, And turn back to the LORD;
(Ps. 86:4) Let us lift our hearts and hands To God in heaven.
(Neh. 9:26; Jer. 14:20; Dan. 9:5) We have transgressed and rebelled; You have not pardoned.
You have covered Yourself with anger And pursued us; You have slain and not pitied.
You have covered Yourself with a cloud, That prayer should not pass through.
You have made us an (1 Cor. 4:13) offscouring and refuse In the midst of the peoples.
(Job 30:9, 10; Ps. 22:6-8; Lam. 2:16) All our enemies Have opened their mouths against us.
(Is. 24:17, 18; Jer. 48:43, 44) Fear and a snare have come upon us, (Is. 51:19) Desolation and destruction.
(Jer. 4:19; 14:17; Lam. 2:11) My eyes overflow with rivers of water For the destruction of the daughter of my people.
(Ps. 77:2; Jer. 14:17) My eyes flow and do not cease, Without interruption,
Till the LORD from heaven (Ps. 80:14; Is. 63:15; Lam. 5:1) Looks down and sees.
My eyes bring suffering to my soul Because of all the daughters of my city.
My enemies (Ps. 35:7, 19) without cause Hunted me down like a bird.
They silenced my life (Jer. 37:16) in the pit And (Dan. 6:17) threw stones at me.
(Ps. 69:2; Jon. 2:3-5) The waters flowed over my head; (Is. 38:10) I said, “I am cut off!”
(Ps. 130:1; Jon. 2:2) I called on Your name, O LORD, From the lowest (Jer. 38:6-13) pit.
(Ps. 3:4) You have heard my voice: “Do not hide Your ear From my sighing, from my cry for help.”
You (James 4:8) drew near on the day I called on You, And said, (Is. 41:10, 14; Dan. 10:12) “Do not fear!”
